The sun generates energy in its core in a process called nuclear fusion. During nuclear fusion, the sun's extremely high pressure and hot temperature cause hydrogen atoms to come apart and their nuclei (the central cores of the atoms) to fuse or combine. Four hydrogen nuclei fuse to become one helium atom.

I saw some comments asking how we know what stars are made of. Here is kind of a simplified answer (from what I remember from my astronomy class haha). The chemical composition of stars can be found by measuring its black body radiation, the wavelengths that are absorbed then released from the star. It's like the famous image of a prism that is hit by photons and then a rainbow is created (Also on Pink Floyd's Dark Side of the Moon), only in stars, certain molecules absorb certain wavelengths of light, creating blank spaces in the "rainbow." By knowing which wavelengths are missing out of the spectrum, you can know the chemical composition because you know which chemical absorbed the missing wavelengths.

The sun is just an electrical effect. The suns ratio of surface area, compared to its volume, causes ambient radiation to slow as it approaches the sun. As ambient radiation slows, it can create massive gravity, a lot of heat, and light.

We know once again that gravity is just a pushing force. We know that large objects appear to have gravity associated with the area around their location. So we must suspect that the planet creates a less repulsive force than the space above it.

I was taught, the planets surface because of the small surface area compared to large volume, creates a bottle neck for ambient radiation. Ambient radiation bound for the planet, is slowed as it approaches that bottle neck at the surface. Inside the planet the ambient radiation is accelerated in a shortage of ambient radiation. It is this small difference of abundance of ambient radiation on the surface and shortage in the planet that creates gravity. This process is very much like an electrical circuit, anything caught between the planet and space, is pushed to the planet.

The proximity to the planet causes an object near a planet, to become abundant with particles of electricity. Ambient radiation is just particles of electricity so you get repulsion towards the planet. The only mystery that I doubt we will ever solve is why particles repel one another.

With the sun you also get heat, from this bottle neck of ambient radiation at the surface of the sun. The sun should go on forever without some kind of unforeseen incident. Ambient radiation is the power for all things, light, heat, ultra violet, and explosions. Matter itself is actually power less, it has no potential energy When caused to become high in voltage, matter can then move, be heated, and give off light. However the matter has no power. Matter is like a sail, ambient radiation the wind.

We live in a perpetual motion universe.

If you stand near a large plastic bag of oxygen and acetylene, right before it is detonated, there is an artificial gravity created. That pushes your body into the bag of yet undetonated gas. As the bag detonates it gives off a bright white flash, very similar to the sun. Before the light from the explosion there is a large amount of Ultra Violet radiation that is created towards the bag of yet undetonated gas.

The earths surface is abundant with particles of electricity, from the bombardment of ambient radiation from space. This causes the surface to raise in voltage, actual voltage. This voltage which is higher than the voltage of clouds or space, is conducted to the surface of a cloud. The cloud in some cases, like a rain cloud, cannot pass the current through the surface of the cloud. And an ARC (Anode, Rectified, Cathode) is created at the surface of the cloud. Just like a welding ARC rod, melts and reciprocates with a ray back against the flow of the power supply. In the case of the cloud you get lightning.

It is all an electrical effect. Nothing is ever lost, no matter has ever been destroyed, no energy has ever been used or lost, it is just redirected, moved, or altered. No two particles have ever touched one another. I can pass a lie detector after slapping someone in the face that I never touched their face with my hand. But I grew up in a very different place, with the science, Hitler, Truman, and Churchill did not want the world to know.


Sincerely.

Just a quick aside, c is a velocity (m/s). M is a mass (g). E is technically measured in joules (J). As a result, according to E=mc^2, E's units must be J = g(m^2)/s^2 (grams times metres squared over seconds squared) The energy that is released is in the form of radiation during Sol's fission reaction. The radiation he described has kinetic properties of moving very fast but actually accelerating to get there. So we can account for an acceleration turn g(m^2)/s^2 into just gm. The g is the mass of the particle that escaped. So what is "The Other m"?

This is the distance that the acceleration will be performed on the escaping particle. Once that distance is up there will be no more acceleration and no more energy in that particle besides potential energy known as kinetic energy. Force will cease to be applied to that object once that distance has been traveled.

But lets not get into how this applies to torque =)

Sorry, my bad, alpha radiation is a high energy helium nucleus, not hydrogen.

An unstable atom which has too many protons will eventually emit radiation, i.e. an alpha particle (two protons and two neutrons), a beta particle (an electron) or a gamma particle (a burst of high-frequency (and so high-energy) photons, light energy).

This is where we use the atomic number. Look at the periodic table. The atomic number is the number of protons. Take that away from the mass, and you get the number of neutrons (total mass = protons+neutrons, each have a very similar mass).

The mass of electrons is negligible, as it barely changes the overall total.
The amount of neutrons in an atom have to be roughly the same (or similar) to the number of protons, otherwise the binding energy is too weak and the atom becomes unstable.

The number of protons determines what element it is, for example a proton and a neutron are a Hydrogen particle (Also known as an Alpha Radiation Particle), however as soon as you add a third proton, it becomes a Helium particle.

That's not entirely accurate, though you got the main idea. It's not that the star's ravitation gets weaker. In fact, the sun will only lose a tiny fraction of its mass through nuclear fusion. What makes a star like the Sun grow to gigantic sizes when it's old has to do with the inability to keep fusing hydrogen (it runs out in the core). Starved, it will start to fuse helium. Helium fusion produces energy at a faster rate. Higher energy rate = more pressure on the outer layers = bigger star.

An excellent question. Less mass doesn't necessarily mean smaller. It all depends on density. If density stayed the same, then you're correct: stars should shrink as they lose mass. But the density of stars -especially their outer layers- can get really low when they're old (like Betelgeuse). As Betelgeuse got old, it puffed up to many many times its original size. While it's got slightly less mass than before, it's much less dense. Hence, bigger.

That isn't correct. A theory and a law are two very different things in science. One never becomes the other. A law is just a statement that describes a mathematical relation, like F=m*a. And a theory is a higher form of knowledge than a law because it combines many observations, ideas, and even laws into a single predictive framework.

Also, science never proves anything! It only tells us how improbable it is that nothing special is going on, then attempts to explain what is actually happening.

When a hypothesis becomes so accepted through experimentration and observation such that we begin successfully using it for practical applications, you can safely assume that the thing is true. You're trying to make an artificial distinction between 'law' and 'theory' where there is none. It seems you're confusing theory with hypothesis. Einstein's relativity is considered to be true, and it is still called the theory of relativity.
Theory means that the thing exists, but may not be completely correct.
You seem to misunderstand the word "theory". Gravitation and evolution have both been proven and understood quite completely, and yet we still call these "theories". Theory does not mean conjecture.

When a star has fused all the hydrogen in its core, nuclear reactions cease. Deprived of the energy production needed to support it, the core begins to collapse into itself and becomes much hotter. Hydrogen is still available outside the core, so hydrogen fusion continues in a shell surrounding the core. The increasingly hot core also pushes the outer layers of the star outward, causing them to expand and cool, transforming the star into a red giant. taken from: science.nasa.gov/astrophysics/

Energy cannot be made nor destroyed. Energy can be released and change form however.

As it's fusing it's actually generating energy, some is let go, but some is stays in the star. That energy heats the star and slowly begins to expand and overcome the force of gravity that keeps the star stable. As it expands it loses energy and cools down somewhat, which allows gravity to take over again and smush it back together. That process happens over and over until the star is unstable and dies.
